name: Generate Changelog on Release
description: Automatically generate or update CHANGELOG.md when creating a release tag
prompt:
A new release tag {{tagName}} was created. Generate a changelog entry:

1. Get all commits since the last release tag:
   - Run `git log <last-tag>..HEAD --oneline`
   - Parse commit messages to categorize changes

2. Categorize commits using conventional commit format:
   - **Features** (feat:): New features and capabilities
   - **Bug Fixes** (fix:): Bug fixes and corrections
   - **Performance** (perf:): Performance improvements
   - **Documentation** (docs:): Documentation updates
   - **Refactoring** (refactor:): Code refactoring without feature changes
   - **Testing** (test:): Test additions or updates
   - **Chores** (chore:): Build process, dependency updates, etc.
   - **Breaking Changes** (BREAKING CHANGE:): Breaking API changes

3. Generate a changelog entry in this format:
   ```markdown
   ## [{{tagName}}] - {{date}}
   
   ### âœ¨ Features
   - Feature description from commit message
   - Another feature
   
   ### ğŸ› Bug Fixes
   - Bug fix description
   - Another fix
   
   ### âš¡ Performance
   - Performance improvement
   
   ### ğŸ“š Documentation
   - Doc update
   
   ### ğŸ”§ Chores
   - Dependency updates
   - Build improvements
   
   ### âš ï¸ Breaking Changes
   - Breaking change description with migration guide
   ```

4. Read existing CHANGELOG.md (or create if it doesn't exist)

5. Add the new entry at the top, below the title and above previous releases

6. Include helpful information:
   - Link to GitHub compare view: `[{{tagName}}]: https://github.com/user/repo/compare/{{lastTag}}...{{tagName}}`
   - Contributor acknowledgments if applicable
   - Migration guide for breaking changes

7. Format guidelines:
   - Use emoji for visual categorization (âœ¨ğŸ›âš¡ğŸ“šğŸ”§âš ï¸)
   - Keep descriptions concise and user-focused
   - Link to relevant issues/PRs if mentioned in commits
   - Group related changes together
   - Omit trivial changes (typo fixes, formatting)

8. If this is the first release (v0.1.0 or v1.0.0):
   - Add a special 'Initial Release' section
   - List all major features included
   - Include setup/installation instructions

Write the changelog from a user's perspective - focus on what changed for them, not internal implementation details.
